items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $84,100 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of September 10, 2014 through October 9, 2014 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
The proposed courses have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that each new course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course offerings.  The list of the new courses are:  
	 
ART 066:  Introduction to Metalsmithing
CIT 073:  Fundamentals of Data Communications and Networking
CIT 074:  IP Routing Protocols
CIT 075:  The Local Area Networks:  Ethernet and Wireless Networks (CCNA)
CIT 076:  Introduction to Wide Area Networks, Network Security & IP Addressing Services
CIT 077:  Introduction to IP Network Security
CIT 078:  Advanced Switching & Campus LAN Design (CCNP) 
CIT 079:  Advanced IP Routing Protocols & Services (CCNP)
CIT 091:  Network Troubleshooting (CCNP)
CIT 092:  Enterprise Wireless Local Area Networks

San Jose City College Early Childhood Education student fees will be paid by the grant, or if the student has Financial Aid, an eligible student will receive an amount to offset the cost of textbooks.

items.item_details: The proposal provides a comprehensive plan that will build a sustainable regional network of community colleges and their partners to prepare the energy efficiency workforce of the future for professionals in every aspect of the commercial and industrial building construction, maintenance and monitor fields as well as the energy and utilities industry. This funding is being driven by the imperatives of California Assembly Bill 32, the specific requirements of Title 24, and many other regulatory and policy pressures. SJCC submitted two of its Applied Science Programs that support these priorities: Air Conditioning and Facilities Maintenance Technology. Based on the number of completions (certificates and degrees) that these two programs produced last year (data was provided by the District Research Office), SJCC was awarded $79,000 to enhance and update current courses that contain energy efficiency components, provide professional development opportunities for faculty, and allow for purchase of supporting equipment.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accepts San Jose City College as one of the 12 Community College's to participate in the BayCLEAN Proposition 39 Clean Energy Workforce Program and accepts the grant awarded of $79,000.
items.item_text: Acceptance of BayCLEAN Proposition 39 Clean Energy Workforce Program Grant
items.item_text_raw: 9. Acceptance of BayCLEAN Proposition 39 Clean Energy Workforce Program Grant

items.item_details:
FIL stands for the Feria Internacional del Libro de Guadalajara, or the International Book Fair in Guadalajara.  Arturo Villarreal, full-time Social Science Professor at Evergreen Valley College, is scheduled to attend FIL December 2-6, 2014.  
	 
Held annually, FIL has a mix of vendors from around the world that market and/or publish Spanish-language books. Originally started in 1987, FIL now hosts over 1,600 publishers from over 39 different countries. It is the largest gathering of Spanish-language books, with approximately 20,000 professionals in attendance, as well as 750,000 members of the general public.  In addition to workshops, there will be literary agents and scouts, distributors, and booksellers that will share information about the materials.  The American Library Association (ALA) calls the event the most important exhibit of Spanish-language books in the world.  
	 
FIL provides a significant cultural bridge between U.S. regions and other Spanish-language areas of the world that share the desire to have materials in Spanish.  Professor Villarreal teaches Chicano and Latino Culture, and attendance at FIL will enhance his knowledge and teaching.  Furthermore, Professor Villarreal oversees the purchase of books and media for the Evergreen Valley College through the Cambios Title V program.  Many librarians from the U.S. and other countries come to secure information pertinent to their situations as there is more and more demand for books in the Spanish-language at all levels, and FIL offers a chance to see these up close.  
	 
Professor Villarreal will receive $500 in Staff Development Funds to apply toward expenses incurred for this event.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of country travel for Professor Arturo Villarreal and funds in the amount of $500.
items.item_text: Out of Country Travel – EVC Faculty Member

items.item_details:
On April 5, 2014 the Board of Trustees approved a contract to S and H Construction in the amount of $488,000 to provide construction services for the Water Service Replacement Project #32311 at the Evergreen Valley College.  
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 001 is for 1) the addition of (2) 10" mainline water shutoff valves to provide Central Plant isolation during emergencies 2) the addition of (2) 8" water shutoff valves at the east hub to provide Visual Arts & Performing Arts building isolation during emergencies 3) Re-route new mainline point of connection at the A&R Building to avoid existing underground interferences 4) Remove and dispose of (35) feet of existing transite piping not shown on contract documents to allow installation of new shutoff valves 5) Extend contract substantial completion date by (18) calendar days, at no additional cost to the District, to accommodate unforeseen field conditions.
 
S and H Construction submitted written pricing proposals for these changes that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $488,000.00
Previously Approved Changes            $    0,000.00
Change Order No. 001                        $  47,679.00
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $535,679.00
	 
The net change to S and H Construction's contract as a result of all changes issued is $47,679.00 which equates to 9.77% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order 001 in the amount of $47,679.00 to S and H Construction, for the Water Service Replacement Project #32311 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Water Service Replacement Project #32311 – S and H Construction Change Order No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Water Service Replacement Project #32311 – S and H Construction Change Order No. 001

items.item_details:
The contract for the Gym Floor Refinishing Project #32307-01 at Evergreen Valley College (EVC), was necessary to refurbish the gym floor surface, repaint existing game lines on the floor, and will benefit the EVC students with a smoother playing surface within the gym and an improved visual appearance.    
	 
On July 8, 2014, the Board approved the Agreement for H.Y. Floor and Gameline Painting, Inc. to perform the Work.  On July 25, 2014, construction activity began and on August 23, 2014, major construction activity was completed.  As of August 23, 2014, all construction work has been approved by the Architect of Record, all closeout documents have been received, Change Orders have been approved and all contracts have been closed.  
	 
Once approved, this Notice of Completion (NOC) will be filed with the County of Santa Clara, Office of the Recorder.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Notice of Completion (NOC) of the contract by HY Floor and Gameline Painting, Inc. for the Gym Floor Refinishing Project #32307-01 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
The contract for the Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing Upgrade Package #2 Project #32307-06 at Evergreen Valley College (EVC), was necessary to provide upgrades to existing mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems on the EVC campus.  The project encompassed approximately 60 small upgrades and repairs into a consolidated project in the Sequoia, PE, LETC, and Gullo Student Services buildings.    
	 
On June 11, 2014, the Board approved the Agreement for JKL Construction Services, Inc., to perform the Work.  On June 18, 2014,  construction activity began and on September 22, 2014, major construction activity was completed.  As of September 22, 2014, all construction work has been approved by the Architect of Record, all closeout documents have been received, Change Orders have been approved and all contracts have been closed.  
	 
Once approved, this Notice of Completion (NOC) will be filed with the County of Santa Clara, Office of the Recorder.

items.item_details:
On August 26, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved an Agreement to Blach Construction Company in the amount of $41,639,729 to provide construction services for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District request design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 002 includes, a new 3” domestic water line valve to accommodate future service needs to a main water line feeding the existing PE building, an add for fire water back flow preventers, and a credit for conduits and wiring to future Electric Vehicle Charging Station locations.  Blach Construction Company submitted written pricing proposals for these changes detailed in the Agenda attachment that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.  
	 
Original Contract Amount                             $41,639,729
Previously Approved Changes                     $   (400,834)
Deductive Change Order No. 002                $     (28,438)
	 
	 
Revised Contract Amount                            $41,210,457
	 
The net change to Blach Construction Company’s contract as a result of all changes issued is ($429,272), which equates to (1.03%) of the original contract.  This change will be funded back to the project construction cost established in the project budget.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Deductive Change Order No. 002 in the amount of ($28,438) to Blach Construction Company for the South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project #32107 – Blach Construction Company Deductive Change Order No. 002
items.item_text_raw: 5. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project #32107 – Blach Construction Company Deductive Change Order No. 002

items.item_details:
In July of 2013, the Board of Trustees approved a Lease-Leaseback project delivery method for the Automotive Technology Building at Evergreen Valley College (EVC).  C. Overaa & Company was awarded a Pre-construction Services Agreement on December 11, 2013, contingent upon a Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) and Site & Facilities Lease Agreements being brought back to the Board for approval.
	 
At the completion of construction documents in December 2013, the project was submitted to Division of the State Architect (DSA) for review and approval.  During that time the architect (Lionakis) and C. Overaa & Company provided construction cost estimates based on those documents.  These estimates indicated the project was over budget. The College, Architect, Contractor and Gilbane evaluated the project scope and identified approximately $500,000 in scope reductions and designated another $300,000 in bid alternates.  Based on this analysis, the anticipated construction cost was approximately $9,900,000.
	 
DSA approved the project in late August 2014.  C. Overaa & Company then put the project out for subcontractor bidding.  Based on the bids received, C. Overaa & Company has presented a GMP of $11,347,704.  The College, Architect, Contractor and Gilbane reviewed the GMP in detail and identified certain items that affected bid prices, most notably market factors such as significant increases in material costs and a very high local construction demand.  The scope had also been increased to support technology and security infrastructures, and instructional fixtures and equipment, that were not included in the original budget.  The project team once again embarked on a significant effort to identify scope modifications that would not impact program quality.  Efforts will continue throughout the course of construction to identify potential cost savings to the project.  
	 
The original budgeted construction value of the project was $9,430,000. The Board of Trustees approved (at the October 28, 2014 meeting) Bond List Revision No. 11 which added $3.3 million to this project in order to cover these additional costs.   
	 
Please note that while this is a “guaranteed” maximum price, the GMP is subject to adjustments for extra work and changes as directed by the District. Upon execution of the Site Lease and the Facilities Lease, C. Overaa & Company will be granted access to and control of the site to commence construction.  Substantial Completion of the construction will be achieved within (365) calendar days from the issuance of the Notice to Proceed.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees execute the Site Lease and Facilities Lease Agreements for the construction of the Automotive Technology Building (Project 32111), at Evergreen Valley College to C. Overaa & Company with a Guaranteed Maximum Price in the amount of $11,347,704.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 – C. Overaa & Company Site Lease and Facilities Lease-Leaseback
items.item_text_raw: 6. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 – C. Overaa & Company Site Lease and Facilities Lease-Leaseback

Intermountain Electric Company, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for these changes that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.

items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 005 in the amount of $1,760.00 to Crusader Fence, for the Campus Site Improvements - Site Fencing, Project #31116-01 at SJCC.

items.item_details:
On February 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to ESI in the amount of $276,000 to provide construction services for the HVAC and Plumbing Upgrades Project #31304-18 at SJCC. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a change order.  Change Order No. 001 includes miscellaneous Owner directed changes, premium shift work and credits for unused allowances. 
                                                            
ESI submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $276,000
Previously Approved Changes            $      0.00
Change Order No. 001                       -$    8,760
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $267,240
	 
The net change to ESI contract as a result of all changes issued is -$8,760 which equates to -3.17% of the original contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 001. in the amount of -$8,760 to ESI, for the HVAC and Plumbing Upgrades Project #31304-18 at SJCC.

items.item_details:
On July 21, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to  Cold Craft, Inc. in the amount of $35,335 to provide construction services and products for the #31107-02 CTE Renovations Project at SJCC.
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions; District requested or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract, scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order. Change Order No.2 is for the contractor to provide upgraded controls for the walk-in freezer and cooler.
	 
Cold Craft, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount           $35,335.00
Previously Approved Changes   $  5,665.00
Change Order No. 002               $  5,340.00
	 
Revised Contract Amount           $46,340.00
	 
The net change to Cold Craft, Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is $11,005, which equates to 31% of the original contract.  Because the change order percentage for this contract exceeds 10%, District staff have consulted with legal counsel and have been advised that this change is allowable upon action of the Board. This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 2 in the amount of $5,340 to Cold Craft, Inc. for the #31107-02 CTE Renovations Project at SJCC.

items.item_details: In conjunction with Scheduled Maintenance Project #31304-19, GE HVAC Upgrades Phase I, Salas O’Brien Engineers worked with SJCC and the Program Manager to provide programming and assessment services to determine college needs and priorities for extending and upgrading the GE HVAC infrastructure and Energy Management System (EMS) in the General Education buildings.  Work related to the GE HVAC Upgrades Phase I project will focus on replacing fan coils throughout the General Education buildings, upgrading the data controls for the EMS and increasing the system efficiency. The Board is asked to approve PAA SJCC-05 to Salas O’Brien Engineers in the amount of $99,500 for Designer/Engineer of Record Services for Project #31304-19 GE HVAC Upgrades Phase I.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC - 05 in the amount of $99,500 to Salas O'Brien Engineering, Inc., for the General Education Building HVAC Upgrades Phase I Project at SJCC.

items.item_details: The ICA and quotes are for the purchase, configuration and installation of network infrastructure switches and wire management for the SJCC 100/200 building per RFP #G2010.0099. The current network switches that were installed in SJCC 100/200 were provided on loan at no-cost for evaluation purposes: HP switches in SJCC 100 and Juniper switches in SJCC 200. The evaluation period ends in December and we need to replace the HP switches in SJCC 100 with Juniper switches, pay for the evaluation Juniper switches in SJCC 200 and wire management in SJCC 100 and 200.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the purchase of network infrastructure equipment for $61,236.91, wire management for $1,161.89 and an Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) with Dasher Technologies for $10,530.00 for the configuration and installation of network equipment and wire management for SJCC 100/200. The total cost is $72,928.80.
items.item_text: Measure G 2010 Bond Program: SJCC 100/200 Network Infrastructure Equipment and Installation Services
items.item_text_raw: 15. Measure G 2010 Bond Program: SJCC 100/200 Network Infrastructure Equipment and Installation Services

items.item_details:
Anderson Brule Architects (ABA) was selected to provide professional design services to develop programming and schematic design documents for the Signage Plan for the New District Office. The plan will primarily address signage requirements on the exterior of the building but will also consider the main lobby, board room, and other selected spaces throughout the building. 
	 
The original Design-Build Contract for the building renovation included a $20,000 allowance for exterior signage, but the District has elected to manage and develop this effort independently and will be receiving a credit back from the Design-Build Contractor for any remaining unused funds associated with this scope of work. The Signage Plan will include a complete vision for the long-range installation of signage strategically placed on the building. This design effort is being funded from the current project budget. Once developed, the complete plan may exceed the current available budget, so signage installation will be prioritized, phased and implemented as funding is available.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) DO-01 in the amount of $37,000 to Anderson Brule Architects, Inc. for the New District Office Building Signage #39301 at New District Office.
items.item_text: Measure G –2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District- New District Office Building Project # 39301, Signage- Anderson Brule Architects, Inc. Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) DO-01
items.item_text_raw: 18. Measure G –2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District- New District Office Building Project # 39301, Signage- Anderson Brule Architects, Inc. Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) DO-01

items.item_details:
On April 29, 2014, the Board of Trustees agreed to enter into a contract with XL Construction Corporation to directly pay the permit fees associated with the project to the San Jose Building Department for the New District Office Building at 40 S Market St., San Jose CA.
	 
Revision No. 001 to the ICA includes the reimbursement of additional jurisdictional fees associated with permitting from Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E), the Department of the State Architect (DSA) and the San Jose Building Department.  These are planned expenses and they have been accounted for in the project budget. XL Construction Corporation assisted the District in expediting the coordination of these authorities and submitted copies of paid invoices. These reimbursements have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The item(s) in this amendment results in an addition to the contract of $16,844.41.
	 
         Original Contract Amount                                   $ 303,874.64
         Previous Approved Revisions                            $     0,000.00
         This Revision No. 001                                        $   16,844.41
                 
         Total Contract and Changes                              $  320,719.05
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Revision No. 001 to Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) in the amount of $16,844.41 to XL Construction Corporation, for the New District Office Building at 40 S Market St.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 9, 2014.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs, and authorizing the reversal of appropriations in certain programs due to the non-receipt of program revenues.

items.item_details: On October 31, 2014, President Obama issued a Presidential Proclamation proclaiming November 2014 as National Native American Heritage Month. In support of this proclamation and in celebration of the achievements of Native American faculty, administrators, staff and students, the San José-Evergreen Community College District participates in events in which Native American culture is celebrated. It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111114-2 in support of November 2014 as Native American Heritage Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111114-2 to designate November 2014 as Native American Heritage Month.
items.item_text: Resolution No. 111114-2 in Honor of Native American Heritage Month
items.item_text_raw: 2. Resolution No. 111114-2 in Honor of Native American Heritage Month

items.item_details: In September 2014, the California state legislature passed Assembly Concurrent Resolution 147 and declared November 2014 as “Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.”  This Resolution would recognize and acknowledge the significant contributions made by Californians of Sikh heritage to the State and afford all Californians the opportunity to understand, recognize, and appreciate the rich history and shared principles of Sikh Americans. It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111114-3 in support of November 2014 as Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 111114-3 to designate November 2014 as Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month.
items.item_text: Resolution No. 111114-3 in Honor of Sikh American Awareness and Appreciation Month

items.item_details:
District staff and Gilbane Construction have annually updated the Board of Trustees on  the outreach program and the continuing efforts by District staff and Gilbane to encourage participation by minority-owned, women-owned, and small businesses, as required by Administrative Procedure 6380. The annual updates compare three years of information  on the diversity of the District’s vendors who chose to self–identify on the District’s Business Enterprise Certification form. The attached two reports are in the format presented to the Board in previous reports.  The definitions of the 3 headings are: 
 
1. Other Funds (Non Measure G-2010)
Amount Paid – Amount paid to vendors that self-identify into each category.
Distribution – Current Fiscal Year distribution in each category.
Prior FY Growth – Prior Fiscal Year growth in each category.
	 
 
2. Measure G-2010
Amount Paid – Amount paid to vendors that self-identify into each category.
 
Distribution – Current Fiscal Year distribution in each category.
Prior FY Growth – Prior Fiscal Year growth in each category.
	 
On July 8, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a consulting agreement with L. Luster & Associates with the expectation to improve upon the data collection and reporting, and achieve tangible, measurable increases in participation by diverse businesses.  The first Outreach formal update for the Trustees from L. Luster & Associates will be presented at this meeting.  Attached is a draft of the L. Luster & Associates Team presentation.
items.item_text: Diverse Business Outreach Update
items.item_text_raw: 1. Diverse Business Outreach Update

items.item_details:
On July 9, 2013 the Board adopted Resolution #70913-2 Lease-Leaseback delivery method for the SJCC Physical Education Building project No. 122. 
	 
The Board approved an Agreement to LPAS, Inc. on April 9, 2014 to provide professional Design Services, Bid Documents, Construction Administration, and Close Out.
	 
Sundt Construction Inc. has been selected as the General Contractor for preconstruction and construction services and was approved by the Board on February 11, 2014.  The project is currently on schedule to begin construction in the Fall 2015 and complete in Spring 2017.
	 
This presentation by LPAS is to provide a project update to the Board of the recently completed 100% Design Development drawings.
